column7: ]Hey[

column84: ]In several ways I could've went out, too many to count[
column85: ]Was it the trigger happy crackers that the badges give clout[
column86: ]Was it the young nigga, blasting frustrated cause the cash running out[
column87: ]Niggas don't know how to act in a drought[
column88: ]See baby girl I realized, my definition of a real nigga was skewed[
column89: ]My views misshaped by new mixtapes[
column90: ]That confirmed the shit I learned from in the streets was true[
column91: ]That real niggas don't speak when they beef with you[
column92: ]They just pull up on your street, let the heat have you[
column93: ]And if a real nigga hungry he gon' eat your food[
column94: ]I was a fool, spent all my time ducking school, ducking cops[
column95: ]Ducking rules, hugging blocks that don't love you[
column96: ]I pray you find a nigga with goals and point of views[
column97: ]Much broader than the corner, if not it's gon' corner you[
column98: ]Into a box, where your son don't even know his pops[
column99: ]And the cyclical nature of doing time continues[
column100: ]My worst fear is one day that you come home from school and see your father face while hearing 'bout tragedy on news[
column101: ]I got the strangest feeling your Daddy gonna lose his life soon[
column102: ]And sadly if you're listening now it must mean it's true[
column103: ]But maybe there's a chance that it's not[
column104: ]And this album remains locked in a hard drive like valuable jewels[
column105: ]And I can teach you this in person like I'm teaching you to tie your own shoes[
column106: ]I love you and I hope to God I don't lose you[
column113: ]One day your daddy called me, told me he had a funny feeling[
column114: ]What he'd been dealing with lately, he wasn't telling[
column115: ]I tried to pick his brains, still he wasn't revealing[
column116: ]But I could feel the sense of panic in his voice and it was chilling[
column117: ]He said "Jermaine, I knew since we was children I never asked for nothing[
column118: ]When times was hard I never had discussions with you begging you to help me[
column119: ]I dealt with the repercussions of my actions[
column120: ]I know you tried to steer me away from that shit[
column121: ]But that shit was in my blood, you know my life[
column122: ]I know your momma nigga, send my love[
column123: ]In case I never get a chance to speak again[
column124: ]I won't forget the weekends spent sleeping at your crib[
column125: ]That's the way I wished my family lived[
column126: ]But my granny crib was in the 'jects[
column127: ]I had to interject like, "Nigga what you talking 'bout? Fuck is you getting at?"[
column128: ]He said "Listen, I got no time to dive into descriptions[
column129: ]But I've been having premonitions, just call it visions from the other side[
column130: ]I got a feeling I won't see tomorrow, like the time I'm living on is borrowed[
column131: ]With that said I'm proud to say I was a father[
column132: ]Write my story down and if I pass go play it for my daughter when she ready[
column133: ]So I'm leaving you this record for your eyes only, don't you ever scratch it disrespect it[
column134: ]This perspective is a real one, another lost Ville son[
column135: ]I dedicate these words to you and all the other children[
column136: ]Affected by all the mass incarceration in this nation[
column137: ]That sent your pops to prison when he needed education[
column138: ]Sometimes I think this segregation would've done us better[
column139: ]Although that means I would never be brought into this world 'cos my daddy was so thrilled when he found him a white girl to take back to Jonesborough with[
column140: ]Little Zach and Cole World barely one years old, now it's thirty years later making sure the story's told[
column141: ]Girl your daddy was a real nigga, not 'cos he was cold[
column142: ]Not because he was the first to get some pussy twelve years old[
column143: ]Not becuase he used to come through in the Caddy on some vogues[
column144: ]Not 'cause he went from bagging up them grams to serving Os[
column145: ]Now your daddy was a real nigga, not 'cos he was hard[
column146: ]Not because he lived a life of crime and sat behind some bars[
column147: ]Not because he screamed fuck the law, although that was true[
column148: ]Your daddy was a real nigga 'cos he loved you"[

column17: ]So now it was like the officer is pulling him inside the car and he's trying to pull away. At no time the officer said that he was going to do anything until he pulled out his weapon. His weapon was drawn and he said, "I'll shoot you" or, "I'm going to shoot" and in the same moment, the first shot went off. We looked down and he was shot and there was blood coming from him. Then we took off running[

column22: ]As we took off running I ducked and hid for my life, because I was fearing for my life. I hid behind the first car I saw. My friend, he kept running, and he told me to keep running because he feared for me too. So as he was running the officer was trying to get out of the car, and once he got out the car he pursued my friend but his weapon was drawn. Now he didn't see any weapon drawn at him or anything like that, us going for no weapon. His weapon was already drawn when he got out the car. He shot again, and once my friend felt that shot, he turned around and put his hands in the air, and started to get down, but the officer still approached with his weapon drawn and he fired 7 more shots and my friend died[
